snippet: Magnus Carlsen, hip and telegenic, is taking on Viswanathan Anand for the world championship title on Saturday, but more is at stake than prize money.
abstract: Magnus Carlsen, 22-year-old Norwegian, and Viswanathan Anand, 43-year-old Indian, will face off in world championship title for chess in Chennai, India, in game that has $2.5 million prize;  future direction of game may be on the line, as Carlsen is a rock star in the chess world and many enthusiasts say he has a big enough personality to re-energize the game.
lead_paragraph: Magnus Carlsen, hip and telegenic, is taking on Viswanathan Anand for the world championship title on Saturday, but more is at stake than prize money.

headline.main: Looking to Norwegian, 22, to Revive Image of Chess
headline.print_headline: Looking to Norwegian, 22, To Revive Image of Chess
